paragraph: CHAPTER V. THE TRIAL.
tokens: trial

paragraph: FOR a moment nobody spoke. The Wallypug sat back in a huddled heap in his chair, looking up into Madame’s face with a scared expression. A. Fish unconcernedly began to eat some steaming porridge from a plate in front of him—and I sat still and waited events.
tokens: moment speak sit huddle heap chair look face scared expression begin eat steam porridge plate front sit wait event

paragraph: A band of musicians in the gallery at the end of the hall were playing somewhat discordantly, till Madame turned around and called out in an angry voice:
tokens: band musician gallery end hall play turn call angry voice

paragraph: “Just stop that noise, will you? I can’t hear myself speak.”
tokens: stop noise hear speak

paragraph: [“STOP THAT NOISE!”]
tokens: stop noise

paragraph: The musicians immediately left off playing with the exception of an old hippopotamus, playing a brass instrument, who being deaf, and very near-sighted, had neither heard what had been said nor observed that the others had stopped. With his eyes fixed on the music stand in front of him, he kept up a long discordant tootling on his own account, gravely beating time with his head and one foot.
tokens: musician leave play exception old hippopotamus play brass instrument deaf sight hear say observe other stop eye fix music stand front keep long discordant tootling own account beat time head foot

paragraph: His Majesty’s Sister-in-Law turned around furiously once or twice, and then seeing that the creature did not leave off, she threw a teacup at his head, and followed it up with the sugar basin.
tokens: turn see creature leave throw teacup head follow sugar basin

paragraph: The latter hit him, and hastily dropping his instrument, he looked over the top of his spectacles in surprise.
tokens: latter hit drop instrument look top spectacle surprise

paragraph: Perceiving that the others had left off playing, he apparently realized what had happened, and meekly murmuring, “I beg your pardon,” he leaned forward with one foot up to his ear, to hear what was going on.
tokens: perceive other leave play realize happen murmure beg pardon learn foot ear hear go

paragraph: “I’m waiting to know what you have to say for yourselves,” resumed Madame, addressing the Wallypug and myself.
tokens: wait know have say resume address

paragraph: “The traid was late, add there was a fog od the lide,” explained A. Fish, Esq., mendaciously, with his mouth full of hot porridge.
tokens: traid late add fog lide explain mouth full hot porridge

paragraph: “A likely story!” said the good lady sarcastically. “A very convenient excuse, I must say; but that train’s been late too many times recently to suit me. I don’t believe a word of what you are saying.”
tokens: likely story say good lady convenient excuse say train late many time suit believe word say

paragraph: “If I might venture a suggestion,” said the Doctor-in-Law, sweetly, “I would advise that they should all be mulcted in heavy fines, and I will willingly undertake the collection of the money for a trifling consideration.”
tokens: venture suggestion say advise mulct heavy fine undertake collection money trifl consideration

paragraph: “It’s too serious a matter for a fine,” said the Madame severely. “What do you mean by it?” she demanded, glaring at me furiously.
tokens: serious matter fine say mean demand glaring

paragraph: “Well, I’m sure we are all very sorry,” I remarked, “but I really do not see that being two minutes late for breakfast is such a dreadful affair after all.”
tokens: sure sorry remark see minute late breakfast dreadful affair

paragraph: “Oh! you don’t, don’t you?” said the Sister-in-Law, working herself up into a terrible state of excitement; “Well, I do, then. Do you suppose that you are going to do just as you please here? Do you think that I am going to allow myself to be brow-beaten and imposed upon by a mere man——”
tokens: say work terrible state excitement suppose go do think go allow brow beat impose mere man

paragraph: “Who hasn’t a hat to his back,” interposed the Doctor-in-Law, spitefully.
tokens: hat back interpose

paragraph: “Hold your tongue,” said the Sister-in-Law. “I’m dealing with him now. Do you suppose,” she went on, “that I am to be openly defied by a ridiculous Wallypug and a person with a cold in his head?”
tokens: hold tongue say deal suppose go defy ridiculous person cold head

paragraph: “I’b sure I havn’d,” declared A. Fish, Esq., indignantly. “By code’s beed cured this last bunth or bore.”
tokens: sure declare code beed cure last bunth bore

paragraph: “Humph, sounds like it, doesn’t it?” said the lady, tauntingly. “However, we’ll soon settle this matter. We’ll have a public meeting, and see who’s to be master, you or I.”
tokens: sound say lady settle matter have public meeting see master

paragraph: “Hooray, public meeting! Public meeting!” shouted all the creatures excitedly.
tokens: hooray public meeting public meeting shout creature

paragraph: “Yes, and at once,” said the Sister-in-Law impressively, getting up and leaving the table, regardless of the fact that scarcely anybody had as yet had any breakfast.
tokens: say get leave table fact have have breakfast

paragraph: The rest of the creatures followed her out of the room.
tokens: rest creature follow room

paragraph: When they had quite disappeared and the Wallypug, A. Fish, Esq., and myself were left alone, I thought that we might as well help ourselves to some breakfast. So I poured out some of the coffee, which we found excellent, and had just succeeded in persuading his Majesty to try a little bread and butter, when some crocodiles appeared at the door and announced: “You are commanded to attend the trial at once.”
tokens: disappear leave alone think help breakfast pour coffee find excellent succeed persuade try little bread butter crocodile appear door announce command attend trial

paragraph: “What trial?” I asked.
tokens: trial ask

paragraph: “Your own,” was the reply. “You and the Wallypug are to be tried for ‘Contempt of Sister-in-Law,’ and A. Fish, Esq., is subpœnaed as a witness.”
tokens: own reply try subpœnae witness

paragraph: “Oh, dear! Oh, dear!” said the poor Wallypug, wringing his hands. “I know what that means. Whatever shall we do?”
tokens: dear dear say poor wring hand know mean do

paragraph: “Dever bide, old chap. I do the best I cad to get you off,” said A. Fish, Esq. “Cub alog, it will odly bake badders worse to delay.”
tokens: bide old chap do good cake get say alog bake badder bad delay

paragraph: So we allowed ourselves to be taken in charge by the crocodiles, and led to the Public Hall, his Majesty and myself being loaded with chains.
tokens: allow take charge crocodile lead public load chain

paragraph: We found the Sister-in-Law and the Doctor-in-Law seated at the judges’ bench when we entered. The Sister-in-Law wore a judge’s red robe, and a long, flowing wig under her usual head-dress, and the Doctor-in-Law was provided with a slate, pencil, and sponge.
tokens: find seat judge bench enter wear judge red robe long flow wig usual head dress provide slate pencil sponge

paragraph: [“SILENCE IN COURT!” SCREAMED THE OSTRICH.]
tokens: silence court screame ostrich

paragraph: We were conducted to a kind of dock on one side of the bench, and on the other side appeared what afterwards transpired to be the witness box. The body of the hall was crowded with animals, craning their necks to catch a glimpse of us.
tokens: conduct kind dock side bench other side appear transpire witness box body hall crowd animal crane neck catch glimpse

paragraph: “Silence in court,” screamed out a gaily-dressed ostrich, and the trial began.
tokens: silence court scream dress ostrich trial begin

paragraph: “We’ll take the man creature first,” said the Sister-in-Law, regarding me contemptuously. “Now then, speak up! What have you got to say for yourself?”
tokens: take man creature say regard speak get say

paragraph: “There appears to be—” I began.
tokens: appear be begin

paragraph: “Silence in court,” shouted the ostrich, who was evidently an official.
tokens: silence court shout ostrich official

paragraph: “Surely I may be allowed to explain,” I protested.
tokens: allow explain protest

paragraph: “Silence in court,” shouted the bird again.
tokens: silence court shout bird

paragraph: I gave it up and remained silent. “Call the first witness,” remarked the Sister-in-Law impatiently, and the Turtle, whom I had seen cleaning the steps in the morning, walked briskly up into the witness-box.
tokens: give remain silent call first witness remark see clean step morning walk witness box

paragraph: “Well, Turtle, what do you know about this man?” was the first question.
tokens: know man first question

paragraph: “So please your Importance, I was cleaning my steps very early this morning, when the prisoner opened the door in a stealthy manner and crept out very quietly. ‘Ho!’ thinks I, ‘this ’ere man’s up to no good,’ and so I keeps him in conversation a little while, but his language—oh!—and what with one thing and another and noticing that he hadn’t a hat, I told him he had better move on. I saw him walk over to the rose garden and afterwards join the Wallypug and Mr. Fish. I think that’s all, except—ahem—that I missed a small piece of soap.”
tokens: importance clean step morning prisoner open door stealthy manner creep think man good keep conversation little while language thing notice hat tell good move see walk rose garden join think miss small piece soap

paragraph: “Soap?” said the Doctor-in-Law, elevating his eyebrows. “This is important—er—er—what kind of soap?”
tokens: soap say elevate eyebrow important kind soap

paragraph: “Yellow,” said the Turtle. “Fourpence a pound.”
tokens: say pound

paragraph: “Hum!” said the Doctor-in-Law, “very mysterious, but not at all surprising from what I know of this person—call the next witness.”
tokens: say mysterious surprising know person call next witness

paragraph: The next witness was the Cockatoo, who scrambled into the box in a great fluster.
tokens: next witness scramble box great fluster

paragraph: “He’s a story-teller, and a pickpocket, and a backbiter, and a fibber, and a bottle-washer,” she screamed excitedly, “and a heartless deceiver, and an organ-grinder, so there!” And she danced out of the witness-box again excitedly, muttering, “Down with him, down with him, the wretch,” all the way back to her seat.
tokens: story teller pickpocket backbiter fibber bottle washer scream heartless deceiver organ grinder dance witness box mutter wretch way seat

paragraph: “Ah, that will about settle him, I fancy,” remarked the Doctor-in-Law, putting down some figures on his slate and counting them up.
tokens: settle fancy remark put figure slate count

paragraph: “What are you doing?” demanded the Sister-in-Law.
tokens: do demand

paragraph: “Summing up,” was the reply. “The judges always sum up in England, you know; that’s thirty-two pounds he owes. Shall I collect it?”
tokens: summ reply judge sum know pound owe collect

paragraph: “Wait a minute till I pass the sentence,” said the Sister-in-Law.
tokens: wait minute pass sentence say

paragraph: “Prisoner at the bar,” she continued, “you have since your arrival here been given every latitude.”
tokens: prisoner bar continue have arrival give latitude

paragraph: “And longitude,” interrupted the Doctor-in-Law.
tokens: longitude interrupt

paragraph: “And have taken advantage of the fact to disobey the laws of the land in every possible way. You have heard the evidence against you, and I may say more clear proof could not have been given. It appears that you are a thoroughly worthless character, and it is with great pleasure I order you to be imprisoned in the deepest dungeon beneath the castle moat, and fined thirty-two pounds and costs.”
tokens: take advantage fact disobey law land possible way hear evidence say clear proof give appear worthless character great pleasure order imprison deep dungeon castle moat fine pound cost

paragraph: Then pointing to me tragically, she called out, “Officers! take away that Bauble!” And I was immediately seized by two of the crocodiles, preparatory to being taken below.
tokens: point call officer take bauble seize crocodile preparatory take
